Speaker: johnnie
Dialogue: They don't want to hear it, Harvey.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: I know, but I want to hear it. Put it up.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Johnnie, you were the one that was late. Just put it up.

Speaker: johnnie
Dialogue: Listen, Harvey. Marvin wants me to present my ideas while your away.

Speaker: johnnie
Dialogue: Look, I'm not doing myself any favours here, Harvey. But, I'd watch your back.

Speaker: marvin
Dialogue: Hey, Harvey. Shouldn't you be in London?

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Yeah, I'm heading there now. What's going on?

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Johnnie said something about you wanting him to present on Monday.

Speaker: marvin
Dialogue: Oh yeah, No, I was just thinking that, what with you being in London - you should stay a while.

Speaker: marvin
Dialogue: There's no need to rush back. Enjoy your daughter's wedding.

Speaker: marvin
Dialogue: Well, Johnnie can do it. I mean, he can pitch the Samuelson account.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: No, I'm coming back. Those are my connections. They have been for years.

Speaker: marvin
Dialogue: I know but... they've got new people running things over there. I think they're after something...  ...different.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: I want to come back. I should be there in person.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: I have to stand behind my music!

Speaker: marvin
Dialogue: They're demos! - They're already pressed. No one needs to be there. They're not looking for you, they're not looking for me. They just need a fucking track.  Harvey, you haven't booked a top line in 8 months.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: You got me doing triangle chimes for Christ's sake - give me something to compose!

Speaker: marvin
Dialogue: That's what I'm trying to tell you! It's not about composition! It's different now!

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: I'm back on Monday, Marvin. I'm coming back.

Speaker: marvin
Dialogue: You got to land this one, Harvey.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: What are you saying?  Say it!

Speaker: marvin
Dialogue: I'm saying there are no more chances, Harvey.  Enjoy London.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Thanks... And could I get another?

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: I'm really sorry but I have a meeting in the morning and I must try and get some sleep.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: It's just, I'll be useless - unless I get some sleep.

Speaker: postman
Dialogue: Morning Kate. Looking lovely as ever. If I was younger...

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Careful Paddy.  Blushing! Is she up?

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: You know, you don't have to keep taking these - the Doctor said.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: I like to. It makes me feel better.  Its 8 o'clock in the morning. Who barbecues at 8?

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: I've got to go. I'll call you later.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Of course. Don't worry about me. I'll be Ok.  Have you got that date thing tonight?

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: I don't know, maybe.  Bye Mum.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: `Time and tide', Kate, as your father liked to say.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Was that from his terrace in the South of France?

Speaker: aggie
Dialogue: Four across. A filmy layer on the surface of a liquid?

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Only if you guys swear you won't leave if it's not going well.

Speaker: oonagh
Dialogue: Aggie, why do you bother? You just get Kate to give you all the answers.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: So you spent the whole 2 weeks in the Toronto area?

Speaker: elderly man
Dialogue: Yes. Our daughter lives there, see.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Ah.  So not a business trip then?

Speaker: elderly man
Dialogue: Oh, no. Unless you count grand- children as work.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Sorry, I couldn't just ask you a few very quick questions, could I?

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: I'm sorry, but I'm in a bit of a hurry.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Look, I'm sorry, but I'm tired, you know?

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Hi Suzie, it's your Dad. I've made it in one piece. I'm in a Taxi on my way to the Hotel. I guess i'll see you all there. Can't wait. Love you.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Hi. I'm with the wedding party. There should be a room for me. Harvey Shine.

Speaker: concierge
Dialogue: Yes. I have a double room for you.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Good. Has everyone else checked in?

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: My daughter. Susan Shine. Or maybe she's already going by Wright. Susan Wright.

Speaker: concierge
Dialogue: No, sir. No one of that name.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Do you have a Mrs Pearce?

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Hello?  Oh...I see. No, I didn't realise. I thought the plan was for everyone to stay together.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: They're completely in again, haven't you heard?

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Ok, mum. Thanks for the advice.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Oh, listen. I've been thinking about Greece for our holiday.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: She's worrying about her new neighbour. Says he barbecues a lot.

Speaker: oonagh
Dialogue: I got you the same as me.  They're at the bar. He seems very nice.

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: Yes. If you can call it work.

Speaker: oonagh
Dialogue: Come on, i'm feeling small down here. Sit!

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Just over by the bed. Thank you. Hello?

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: This is Susan's father, Harvey. Harvey Shine.  Harvey, this is my best man, Josh Stillman and Pete Turner.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: How are you Harvey?  Its great to see you.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Good thanks. Great.  How are you holding up?

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: Great.  Can't wait to marry your daughter, really.

Speaker: scott
Dialogue: She's through there. She'll be thrilled you're here. I'll go and find her.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Oh, I'm a...  I work in the music industry.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Oh, you know, for...commercials, that sort of thing. TV.  Mostly background stuff, that sort of thing.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: It can be.  You guys work with Scott?

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Well, I'm sure that's pretty profitable too.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Well, I'd better find my daughter.

Speaker: pete
Dialogue: Absolutely. Good to meet you, Harvey. See you in there.

Speaker: oonagh
Dialogue: Nice? Nice like good. Or nice like dull.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Nice like how old is he?

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: He can't be, he's looks like a baby.

Speaker: oonagh
Dialogue: Alright, my age. But Matt says he's very mature.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Oh right. Did Matt offer that up - or was that in response to you two discussing my approaching barrenness.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: I have to. She's on her own.  She gets lonely.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Give us a hug then, as they say in this country.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Long way to come to see two American kids get married.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Yes. They're over by our table.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: I'll speak to you later Suz. You enjoy your friends.

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: Looks like we've been set up.

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: No. It's not your fault. I mean, I'm fine with it. I mean, I'm happy to meet new people.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Yes.  Sorry, I'm saying `yes' a lot.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Ye...  Sure. I can get them.

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: No, it's fine. What do you fancy?

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: I'll have another white wine. Anything dry.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: So our baby girl is really getting married. Who would've thought?

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Harvey you remember the Watsons. Barry and Jill.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Of course I do. Hell, its been a while. I guess, not since Jean and I split up.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Thank you, Jill. You're looking well too. Both of you. I guess you guys stayed in touch with Jean.

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Barry and I work together now.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: No.  Property, now. A small portfolio down in Florida.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Real Estate. That's great.  That's really great.

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Well I think we should sit. I know Susan wanted us all seated before they joined us.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Mum. You've got to stop calling.  What? I can't hear. Hold on.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Have you told him its Harvey? Look, we go back! He'll tell you. Just have him call me.

Speaker: jean
Dialogue: No, Harvey. I didn't touch it.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Dad. I moved you. I thought it might be easier in case you needed to get out.

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Shall we have a quick toast to get things going?  Dear Susan and Dear Scott, I just want to take us all back to that wonderful holiday we all had in Rome together last year and wish you `Salute'!

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Jean and I love you both so much. And we're so happy that Scott is going to part of our clan now. And so I say many, many, happy, happy years ahead. Salute!

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: Hey. Kate.  Everyone this is Kate.

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: Kate this is Andrew, Melissa, Gwen, and Elinor.

Speaker: melissa
Dialogue: Sorry, I hope we're not barging in on your evening.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: We don't really. We just met.

Speaker: melissa
Dialogue: I see. I think we should leave you guys alone.

Speaker: andrew
Dialogue: Hey does anyone know the cricket score?

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: England were all out by tea, when I last checked.

Speaker: melissa
Dialogue: What? Men in white. Oh, I do.

Speaker: gwen
Dialogue: I heard that they did it in her bedroom, while she was away.

Speaker: gwen
Dialogue: Yep. He has his own, but was basically living at hers.

Speaker: jean
Dialogue: Can I get a glass of water please?

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Why, Jean? Are you worried i'm going to embarrass you again?

Speaker: jean
Dialogue: No Harvey, I'm worried you're going to embarrass yourself.  And more importantly Susan. This weekend's just about her and Scott. Nothing else.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Oh, you're good Jean. You're really good. You've always known how to make me feel shit, haven't you?  You've always been so good at that.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Tell me, Jean. Were you ever proud of me?

Speaker: jean
Dialogue: Yes. Sometimes.  But you never listened.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: The parties Jean. The fuckin' parties, where I would hear you - dressing up what I did for a living - film composer this, film composer that - trying to make it more palatable for your friends. I'm a...

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: What is it you see in Brian?

Speaker: jean
Dialogue: He doesn't talk about himself.  He talks about me.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Yeah. I'm great. How are you doing? Enjoying yourself?

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: He seems a good guy, Scott. You'll be alright.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Yeah, he is.  I'm sorry, I haven't had much time to talk to you.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: No Sweetheart, it's your weekend. It's no problem. You just enjoy yourself.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Great.  Well, not great, but...fine. You know the usual. Triangle chimes.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Are you still doing your own stuff? You should.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: It just can't be helped. But I'll be there at the ceremony, at the really important bit. I'll be there to give you away.  And then I'm sure Brian or your mother will talk at the reception. You know me, I've never been very good at speech...

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Dad, I've hardly seen you in the past five years.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Dad, it is. Maybe a quick coffee here, or a telephone call there but no, you haven't been part of my life. And...  And Brian has.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: I'm sorry Dad, but it's what I've decided.

Speaker: taxi driver
Dialogue: It's going to be bad everywhere. Your president's in town. It's causing chaos.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: I'm sorry but, I'm on the 4.30 to JFK.

Speaker: waiting passenger
Dialogue: Hey pal, we're all in hurry.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Just hand luggage, can i go straight to the gate?

Speaker: steward
Dialogue: Sir, I'm dealing with a passenger, you'll have to wait.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Please. I've gotta make that flight.

Speaker: steward
Dialogue: Sir, everyone is in a hurry. You'll just have to wait.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Miss, i'm on the 4.30 to JFK. Can you check me in?

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: But it's not yet 4! I just have hand luggage. It doesn't take off for another 40 minutes.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: But I just have hand luggage. Please. I've got to get on that flight.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Marvin. It's Harvey. Listen, there's been a mess up, the traffic was crazy. I'm going to have to reschedule the pitch slightly. Frank can set up. I'll email him the cue numbers - he knows what to do. And then I'll be there lunch- time at the latest. I'll come straight from the airport. I'll try you again shortly.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: The traffic was insane. But listen...

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: It's fine, I'll be there lunch- time. It's no problem. Steve knows what I need. Mike's coming in. It's all set u...

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Letting me go? Can't afford the space? Marvin, I'll be there lunch- time.

Speaker: marvin
Dialogue: I'm sorry Harvey.  Call me when you get back.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: For yesterday. I was rude. You tried to ask me some questions.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: I don't really remember, but I'm sure you were. Most people are.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: It probably would be, if i could finish it.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: I reckon it'll help as much as that trashy novel and a glass of chardonnay.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: I'm really sorry. That was out of line.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: What? Go away and stop apologizing.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: It's just that i've had a really shitty day.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: No. I mean really shitty. Yours may have been shitty, but mine was shittier.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: I missed my flight. I lost my job. And my daughter who got married in London today asked her step father rather than me to give her away.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Not bad.  Make it worse, maybe?

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Let me make it up to you.  Would you let me buy you lunch. What time is it - tea time? I'll buy you tea.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: That's very sweet of you, but... I don't know you. And... you don't know me.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Exactly. That's why we should have lunch - tea.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Because you've got your book. And it's a good replacement for humans.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Should I take that as a hopeful sign.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: If it is, you could just give me a little wider smile.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Look we are having lunch together.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: No. We're having lunch next to each other.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Ah, that's better. I knew something was missing.  I had to get back for a work thing.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: A work thing. For the job you just lost?

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: So, this job you lost. You liked it?

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: No. Not really. They've beaten it out of me. But its what i do - did.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Yes. Uh...Uh...  Well, maybe, I mean it maybe before your time.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: You can take the Salem out of the country - but you can't take the country out of Salem.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: No, I just love the way you...you just cut through it.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: I'll take that as a compliment.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: You should.  I was going to be a Jazz pianist.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: I'm sorry, I can be nosey. I tend to blurt stuff out.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: No. I like it. I like it...  ...Alot.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: That's all changed. We're a nation changed. Ever since Diana, we've unlocked ourselves. Everything's flowing out.  You guys showed us the way.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Just as we're trying to adopt your stiff upper lip.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: No, I think, it's more this.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Yeah you're getting there. Stretch it out further.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: No, now you're doing a bulldog.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: No, now you look like you don't have any teeth.  Are they your own?

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: My dad had a front one that you could just take out.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: I should get going. I have a class.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: I don't know. I guess I'll stay in a Hotel near here. My flight's in the morning.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: I'd like a room please.  One night.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Taxi's are over there. They'll take you to wherever you need to go.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Yes.  Stand near the curb so you don't get splashed.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Yours is a beautiful city, Kate.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Its just a funny way of saying it. Quite old fashioned.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: But i like it.  Yours is glorious country, Honeychurch.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: I'm afraid I'm not much of a reader.  Too fidgety, I guess.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: No, we're just quite different, that's all.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Both our phones ring a lot. We have that in common.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: And herself.  She's convinced she's living next to Poland's answer to Ted Bundy.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: She means well. She's just had a tough run.  She's basically bored. And my continued `situation' as she calls it, being single, is her major distraction. Her pastime if you will.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Yes, my rotting eggs are her raison d'tre.  Sorry.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Hmm.  Well, here we are. My class.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Can I wait?  Sorry - I promise I'm not `Bundyish'.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: It's getting cold. You don't want to wait.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Careful, I might get the wrong impression.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Oh, the usual.  Lovely mild-mannered Mike read us the latest installment from his Physcho-Sexual Thriller, and we all tried to look at him in the same way after.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Do you ever wish you could try a different life?  Just for a day. Just to see what it would be like.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Well, no green, that's for sure.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: And what would you do there?

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Oh...I don't know...  I think I've got one inside me. We're not talking high art. Just a bloody good holiday read.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Ok. So this house in Spain would have a little cabana looking out over the plains for you to write in.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: And a little stream running by, to bathe in.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: I'm there.  Sorry, that's if you're receiving guests.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Sure, you can visit Harvey Shine.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: What happened Harvey?  Between you and your daughter?

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: I don't know.  I just woke up one morning and realised i didn't belong.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: The reception. It's still going on?

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: What the hell are you doing here? You must go!

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Stop feeling so sorry for yourself. She's your daughter, you're her father. Go!

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Wait. I'm thinking.  Only if you come with me.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Please, come with me. As my...bodyguard.  As my friend.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Harvey, firstly, i'm not about to go to anyone's wedding in a green polyester work suit. Secondly it's not right.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: We'll find you a dress. If we find you a dress, will you come?

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: I'm really sorry to gate-crash. Your father sort of insisted.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: No, it's fine. I'm sure...  ...there's room.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: You get back. Don't worry about us, we'll find a place.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: No.  Could you find them a seat please.

Speaker: waiter
Dialogue: I'm afraid this is the only place left.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Oh.  You're not Miriam's kid are you?

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Wow...You've...got big. I mean grown up.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: So without further ado, I'd like to propose a toast to Susan for making my friend Scott complete.

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Well, that's quite some speech Josh. Quite something to follow. But I shall try...

Speaker: jean
Dialogue: For God's sake Harvey, don't make a scene.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: No Jean. I want to make a scene. You know. I'm tired of being embarrassed.  If we can't make a scene on the day of our daughter's wedding, then when can we? I want to make a scene. I want to shout! I wanna tell the world how lucky it is to have our Suzie in it!

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: I wanna tell Scott, how damn lucky he is!

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: And also if he ever hurts her, I know people in north of London.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: And I can see from the way she looks at you. From the way she is with you, that she is...

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: If you would all please join Harvey and I, in a toast.  To Susan and Scott.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: You are very kind. But...no.  Shearing doing Rogers.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Ah.  Well...you play it very well.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: But, you know, maybe I want to be with you.  You make me happy - when skies are grey.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Come on. I want you to meet people. I want them to meet you.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: I don't think I've stayed up all night since I was a student.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Oh, I don't know. My uniform's green?

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Exactly here, at these chairs. At noon.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: I don't want to leave.  Guess why.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: You say that now, but wait until tomorrow.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Harvey we know nothing about each other. You're...

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: A bit older, yes.  I can be mean. Really mean.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: I know enough to know, I'll be here. Waiting, at this chair.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Noon. I mean it.  I'll be here.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Can I have something until tomorrow.

Speaker: concierge
Dialogue: I'm afraid they're both out of order, Sir.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: I've got to go. I've got to be somewhere.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Sir, I need you to stay calm. It looks to me like Arrhythmia - an irregular heart-beat.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Yes, S.V.T'S, that's what I've been trying to tell the nurse. I've had it since I was a kid. I take Primax. I guess i've been forgetting to take it recently. I've been under alot of stress, that's all.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Well Ok, then we probably know where we're at. But I need to check all possibilities.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: I know it's Arrhythmia! Please, I have to be there.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Sir, I'm 99% sure it is. But my job is to make sure it's not that 1%. I wouldn't be doing my job if I didn't check out absolutely everything.  Nurse, we'll do an EKG, followed by Bloods. And can you arranfe a monitored bed for him for tonight.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Ok mum, that's me, I'm done.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Why don't you stay and have some lunch?

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: I can't, I've got to go.  Not to pry or anything but why is there a large smoked ham under the stairs?

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Oh, that, yes...It's, um...The neighbour gave it to me.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: The polish neighbour?  So probably not a mass murderer.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Of course I will. I'll be fine.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Men, who needs them. Remember we've got Greece to look forward to.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: It's some sort of Statistics Agency.  Miss, could I borrow, your pen.

Speaker: oonagh
Dialogue: I'm sorry, she's busy.  She won't come.

Speaker: receptionist
Dialogue: If I could just get you to sign these, you'll be all done.

Speaker: marvin
Dialogue: Hey Harvey, it's Marvin. Where are you?

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Oh, I'm still in London, Marvin.

Speaker: marvin
Dialogue: Well you get yourself back here my friend. I've got some great news. You were right. The Samuelson account. None of the kids could handle it. They couldn't nail it. They ended up picking one of your old tunes. They want you to come back and update it.  Harvey?

Speaker: marvin
Dialogue: Yeah. Yeah, `it's great'. I mean, look, I know when to eat humble pie. So look, hey, when can you get back here?  Harvey?

Speaker: marvin
Dialogue: What you mean you quit? Harvey, fuck you man, you need us.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: No, you know, I don't. As you said, it's my `last chance'.  Look, I gotta go.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Excuse me, I'm looking for a Kate. Kate Walker.

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: A friend.  More than a friend.

Speaker: aggie
Dialogue: There's a man here looking for Kate, says he's `more than a friend.'

Speaker: oonagh
Dialogue: She's left for the day.  I think it starts around now. Down on the Southbank. At the National.

Speaker: oonagh
Dialogue: Oh you do, do you?  Well, go on. Go get her.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: The blood oozes from his wound like dark chocolate on a warm summer's day.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: You're still here - still in London...

Speaker: harvey
Dialogue: Yeah.  Kate, I just wanted to apologise and explain...

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: No, you don't have to - explain - it's fine -

Speaker: kate
